job.title: Software Quality Assurance Engineer
job.industry: Computer Software,Information Technology and Services,Consumer Electronics
job.description:
Hamilton Porter
is a boutique technical recruiting firm that partners with a variety of companies ranging from start-ups to Fortune 500's. Due to growth, one of our
top clients
in the
Las Vegas
area is actively looking to hire a full-time
Software QA Engineer
to join the team. Our client is a leading provider of hardware and software products that are heavily leveraged to enable automated payment/transaction processing in industries such as banking, finance, gaming, kiosk, retail, transportation, and vending. This role will have focus primarily on
black box
testing (functional & regression testing).
In this role, you will be looked upon to create, plan, and execute test strategies and frameworks. Work with SQA Engineers and Software Engineers to complete system design review, code reviews, analyze system performance, create test plans, black box testing, functional testing, debug code defects, document the defects and suggest improvements. You will partner closely with Software Engineers to assist in testing new features during the development cycle.
Role & Responsibilities:
Review technical requirements and specifications to create test plans and test cases
Experience building and maintaining test systems
Complete functional testing while also being able to perform other types of testing (unit, system, integration, user acceptance, regression, usability and end-to-end testing)
Review, test, and debug source code while documenting and reporting bugs/defects in JIRA
Collaborate heavily with the software engineering team to test new feature and fix bugs
Experience troubleshooting and debugging web-based & mobile products
Requirements:
2+ years of software engineering and/or software testing experience with a Bachelor's in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field
Functional & Regression testing experience
Experience testing and debugging software technology using C#, HTML, SQL, and JavaScript
Experience testing and debugging software in Microsoft Visual Studio and Google Chrome
Ability to read, troubleshoot and debug source code written in C# and C++
Compensation & Benefits:
Competitive Annual Salary
Health Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision)
Life Insurance, Short & Long Term Disability Insurance, AD&D Insurance
FSA Options
401(k) Plan - 50% match up to the first 2% of employee deferral and 25% of the next 12% of employee deferral
4 day work week (10 hours per day) - enjoy a 3 day weekend every weekend!!!
12 days vacation, 40 hours of sick time, 11 paid holidays, and more!
We are looking to interview and hire ASAP. This is a fantastic opportunity with lots of growth potential, please apply with your resume!
*Please note, all candidates must complete a background check and drug screening prior to employment*
